events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses and consolidate some credit card debt.
The loan application was categorized as a personal loan based on the stated purpose of medical bills and debt consolidation.
A loan officer was assigned to guide the applicant through the loan process and answer any initial questions.
The application underwent an initial review to verify that all required fields were completed and initial eligibility criteria were met.
The applicant was requested to provide income proof, medical bills, and recent bank statements to support the loan application.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including medical invoices and pay stubs, to complete the verification process.
The credit check was completed, revealing a moderate credit score with some outstanding debts that are now being consolidated.
The risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s financial situation, existing debts, and repayment capacity for the personal loan.
Based on the assessment, an offer detailing the loan amount, repayment schedule, and interest rate was presented to the applicant.
The applicant provided positive feedback on the loan offer, confirming interest and agreeing to proceed with the terms presented.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee for final approval due to the loan amount requested.
The loan was formally approved by the senior committee, confirming all conditions and rates as previously discussed.
Funds were disbursed into the applicant’s bank account to cover the medical bills and debt consolidation as planned.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant was satisfied with the loan process and to offer assistance with repayment scheduling.
The loan application case was officially closed after successful funding and positive follow-up feedback from the applicant.
